{{Unnamed}} {{infobox character | name="F" | people=[[Men|Man]] (early)
[[Wraiths|Wraith]] (later) | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Mordor]] and probably [[Dol Guldur]] | affiliation=[[Nazgûl]]
[[Eye of Sauron]] | language=[[Mannish]]
[[Black Speech]] | birth=[[Second Age]] | birthlocation=[[Middle-earth]] | rule= | death=[[25 March]] {{TA|3019}} | deathlocation=[[Morannon]] | age=4200+ | notablefor=Aiding [[Khamûl]] with pursuing [[Frodo Baggins]] | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed=Black horse }} In a manuscript by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], a [[Nazgûl]] simply labeled "'''F'''" accompanied [[Khamûl]] in tracking the [[Shire-hobbits]] during the [[Hunt for the Ring]].{{NM|Hunt}}, pp. 374-5 ==History== Like the other Nazgûl, "F" was one of nine [[Men]] to whom [[Sauron]] gave one of the [[Nine Rings|Rings of Power]], who became mighty kings, sorcerers or warriors, and eventually faded into a [[Wraiths|wraith]] that was under the rule of Sauron.{{S|Rings}} By {{SA|2251}} "F" and the other eight Men who had received rings of power first appeared as Ringwraiths.{{App|SA}}, entry for the year 2251, p. 1083 In {{TA|2951}}, when Sauron declared himself openly to his enemies, "F" was probably{{HM|RC}}, citing from an unpublished version of ''The Hunt for the Ring'', p. 97 one of the two Ringwraiths under [[Khamûl]]'s command that were sent to [[Dol Guldur]].{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2951, p. 1089{{UT|Black}} In the evening of [[23 September]],{{App|Great}}, pp. 1091-2 after the Nazgûl approach near the [[Three-Farthing Stone]] in [[the Shire]], "F" probably lurked south of [[Whitfurrows]], watching the [[East Road]] and the [[Stock Road]] as Khamûl arrived in [[Hobbiton]] and asked [[Hamfast Gamgee]] about "Baggins".{{HM|RC}}, citing from an unpublished version of ''The Hunt for the Ring'', p. 99 On [[25 September]], "F" was summoned by Khamûl with cries after failing to find [[Frodo Baggins]] on the ridge above [[Woodhall]]. Together, they ride east over the fields and visit [[Farmer Maggot]].{{FR|Mushrooms}}, pp. 93-4 After leaving Farmer Maggot, "F" was sent off by Khamûl to head down the [[Causeway]] in the direction of the [[Overbourn Marshes]]. "F" reached the [[Bucklebury Ferry]] at night soon after Khamûl arrived too late to the catch the Hobbits before they crossed the [[Brandywine River]].{{HM|RC}}, citing from an unpublished version of ''The Hunt for the Ring'', p. 116 ==Other versions of the legendarium== In an early draft of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' labeled "Scheme D", Tolkien identified each Nazgûl by letters between A and I. It is not known which of these early draft labels correspond with "F". The Nazgûl trailing "the hobbits in the Shire" were labeled "'''D'''" and "'''[[E]]'''" respectively.{{TI|Gandalf}} == Portrayal in adaptations == '''1987: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]—[[Lords of Middle-earth: Vol. II]]'':''' :[[Seventh of the Nazgûl|Adûnaphel]] is mentioned in the supplement as one of the Ringwraiths sent to Dol Guldur, as well as being the only of that group to accompany Khamûl in the Shire, which would likely make her "F".{{ICE|8003}}, p. 83 {{References}} [[Category:Characters in The Lord of the Rings]] [[Category:Nazgûl]] [[Category:Second Age characters]] [[Category:Servants of Sauron]] [[Category:Third Age characters]]
